system.description:
The caster of this spell stamps his foot on the ground and a patch of earth, centered on his position and 35 paces across, slowly but inexorably rises up for the duration of the spell. The earth rises at a rate of about one inch per day (up to three feet over the spell duration).
This is fast enough for people to observe if they watch the earth for more than a Diameter, and the movement can destroy buildings and other structures â€” even the strongest castle walls run the risk of collapse.
This spell only works when cast within a league of a volcano (three miles). This is because this movement is only a slightly unnatural property of the earth in such regions, whereas it is a grossly unnatural property of earth elsewhere.
